name: Perception of students' lives
question: How do you perceive your academic and social live in college/university?

cards.text: I am satisfied with my academic progress.
I feel like I am learning and growing as a person in college.
I often feel stressed or overwhelmed by schoolwork.
I have close friendships with other students.
I feel like I fit in well with my peers.
I am involved in extracurricular activities on campus.
I am satisfied with my social life at college.
I often feel homesick or lonely.
I feel like I am part of a community on campus.
I have a clear sense of my academic and career goals.
I feel like I am making a meaningful contribution to the world through my studies.
I often feel like I am just going through the motions in college.
I feel like I am challenged and pushed to grow intellectually in college.
I am comfortable speaking up in class and participating in discussions.
I feel like I am getting a good value for my tuition dollars.
I have a positive relationship with my academic advisor.
I feel like I have a good work-life balance.
I feel like my professors are invested in my success.
I am able to manage my time effectively.
I am satisfied with the quality of the courses and curriculum.
I feel like I have access to the resources and support I need to succeed.
I have a strong sense of belonging on campus.
I feel like I am challenged to think critically and creatively in my classes.
I have a good relationship with my roommates.
